Description.val:
The M870A4 SEMITRAILER is a 40-Ton payload, mechanical folding gooseneck, level-deck trailer with rear ramps capable of handling payloads on primary, secondary, and trail profile roads. The primary mission of the M870A4 is to transport engineering equipment as well as pavers, compactors, the Hydraulic Excavator (HYEX) and dozers. The M870A4 is an enabling capability for theater access operations to provide transport of construction equipment used by units for horizontal construction projects in support of military or other national goals and objectives. The M870A4 supports construction and maintenance of main supply routes, logistical facilities, bituminous roads, helipads, airfields, landing strips, motor pools and parking areas supporting sustainment operations throughout the full spectrum of operations. The Army Acquisition Objective (AAO) is 2,767.

The M871A3 SEMITRAILER is a 22.5-Ton drop deck/break-bulk (DD/BB) container transporter. It is a tactical, dual purpose, bulk and container transporter. It transports 20-foot ISO (International Organization for Standardization) containers on line haul missions and is the primary means of distributing containers and bulk cargo. The AAO is 4,591. 

The M872A4 SEMITRAILER is a 34-Ton dual purpose, break-bulk container transporter. The M872A4 is a commercially-adapted semitrailer, with missions to transport a single 40-foot or two 20-foot ISO (International Organization for Standardization) containers, palletized cargo, and light combat and tactical vehicles. The M872A4 supports sustainment operations and freedom of movement and is critical for moving large volumes of cargo from ports to Division areas supporting full-spectrum military operations. The M872 is a readiness pacing item for Army Medium Truck Companies. The AAO is 7,142.

The M172 SEMITRAILER LOW BED 25-Ton is used to transport construction equipment, Class IV construction materials and logistical provisions supporting mobility, counter-mobility, survivability and sustainment operations. The Semitrailer Low Bed (STLB) is a commercially-adapted semitrailer with a 25-ton payload capacity, flat level-deck and rear loading ramps. Funds in this budget line are a new start program. The AAO is 1,299.

Justification.val:
D00700 / SEMITRAILER 40-Ton (M870): FY 2019 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $3.475 million supports M870A4 Production Verification Testing (PVT) of the low-rate initial-production (LRIP) trailers. PVT will include performance and endurance testing to meet Key Performance Parameters (KPPs) of Payload, Transportability and Deployability towards Full Rate Production (FRP).

D01600 / SEMITRAILER 34-Ton (M872): FY 2019 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $11.858 million supports the procurement of 111 M872A4 semitrailers to respond to line haul transportation requirements and address urgent readiness needs. The M872 semitrailer is a readiness pacing item for Army Medium Truck Companies and is critical for moving large volumes of cargo from ports to Brigade Combat Team (BCT) areas. A world-wide inspection of M872A0-A3 trailers found severe corrosion and 48 percent of the fleet are designated as non-mission capable (NMC) items requiring replacement. The majority of the M872 semitrailer fleet is aged beyond its economic useful life (EUL) and needs to be replaced. 

D01650 / SEMITRAILER LOW BED 25-Ton (M172): FY 2019 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $1.618 million supports the procurement of nine (9) low-rate initial-production (LRIP) semitrailers. LRIP trailers will support first article test (FAT) and production verification test (PVT). The existing M172 trailer fleet has an average age over 50 years old. Funds in this budget line are a new start Program.

D01600 / SEMITRAILER 34-Ton (M872): FY 2019 OCO procurement dollars in the amount of $8.000 million supports the procurement of 78 M872A4 semitrailers to respond to line haul transportation requirements and address urgent readiness needs for the European Deterrence Initiative (EDI). The M872 semitrailer is a readiness pacing item for Army Medium Truck Companies and is critical for moving large volumes of cargo from ports to Brigade Combat Team (BCT) areas. A world-wide inspection of M872A0-A3 trailers found severe corrosion and 48 percent of the fleet are designated as non-mission capable (NMC) items requiring replacement. The majority of the M872 semitrailer fleet is aged beyond its economic useful life (EUL) and needs to be replaced. 

The quantities in the D01001 P-40 Resource Summary and Secondary Distribution Table have been temporarily suppressed in the database to avoid confusion between the Exhibits. The correct quantities for FY 2019 Base are as follows:
D00700 / SEMITRAILER 40-Ton (M870): 0 trailers
D01600 / SEMITRAILER 34-Ton (M872): 189 trailers (111 ea w/Base funds + 78 ea w/OCO (EDI) funds)
D01650 / SEMITRAILER LOW BED 25-Ton (M172): 9 LRIP trailers 
Total for FY 2019 D01001: 198 trailers

Gross Weapon System Unit Cost increase from FY 2018 to FY 2019 (Base) is due to the fact that two of the three semitrailer programs being funded in FY 2019 are not yet in full rate production and most of the funding is dedicated to testing and test/program support. 

The FY 2019 funding request was reduced for $0.475 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances

IAW Section 1815 of the FY 2008 National Defense Authorization Act (P.L. 110-181), this item is necessary for use by the active and reserve components of the Armed Forces for homeland defense missions, domestic emergency responses, and providing military support to civil authorities.

OverallHistoryPlanningRemarks.val:
M870A4 Acquisition Strategy: 2 contractors were awarded an Indefinite Delivery Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) contract in August 2016 for two trailers each for a competitive run-off test prior to execution of Low Rate Initial Production (LRIP) award.  Evaluation of Fair Opportunity Submission Request (FOSR) will result in the award of Delivery Order #2 in 3QFY2018 for 11 LRIP trailers. Completion of Production Verification Test (PVT) and Developmental Test / Operational Test (DT/OT) will occur in FY 2020, with Full Rate Production (FRP) decision in FY 2021.

FY 2017 includes a quantity of 202 M872A4 Semitrailers awarded to Talbert Manufacturing Inc. FY 2017 funds for M872 Semitrailers were placed on the M870 Semitrailer funding line in early October 2017. The remaining FY 2017 quantity of 49 are M870A4 Semitrailers. The combination of these two procurement funding lines in FY 2017 also resulted in a fluctuating gross weapon system unit cost on this (D00700) Exhibit.

Name.val: SEMITRAILER FB BB/CONT TR 34T M872 C/S

OverallHistoryPlanningRemarks.val: FY 2018 OPA Base funds, FY 2019 OPA Base funds and FY 2019 OPA OCO (EDI) funds will be used for the reprocurement of M872A4 Semitrailers under a sole source, multi-year contract with Talbert Manufacturing of Rensselaer, Indiana. Talbert Manufacturing is the OEM of the M872A4 and owns the Technical Data Package (TDP). TACOM Contracting Center will negotiate a multi-year, sole source, FFP, IDIQ contract utilizing FY18-FY24 OPA funds. There is an immediate need for M872A4 semitrailers since 48% of the M872A0-A3 semitrailer fleet has recently been coded as unserviceable due to severe corrosion.

OverallDeliveryScheduleRemarks.val: Gross weapon system unit cost decrease from FY 2018 to FY 2019 is due to the fact that the FY 2018 M872A4 hardware cost was based on an estimate before actual contract costs were known. FY 2019 hardware cost is based on actual contract award, which resulted in a negotiated lower unit cost.

OverallHistoryPlanningRemarks.val: Funds in this budget line are a new start program. Contract will be awarded 2QFY19 and nine (9) trailers will be purchased with FY19 OPA Base funding. First Article Testing / Production Verification Testing will begin 1QFY20.
